newsitem.title: USA: Nevada Mohave coal-fired unit back up to 600 MW.
newsitem.headline: Nevada Mohave coal-fired unit back up to 600 MW.

text.p: The 790 megawatt (MW) unit 1 at the Mohave coal-fired power plant near Laughlin, Nevada, was back up to 650 MW where it will remain due to cooling tower restrictions, sources familiar with the plant said Tuesday.
The unit was restarted around 1400 PST Monday after being shut earlier in the day because of an unspecified operating problem.
Mohave's 790 MW unit 2 was said to be operating at 700 MW and is also expected to remain at that rate.
The Mohave plant is majority owned and operated by Edison International's Southern California Edison Co.
